desc: Improve the user’s experience to conform to performance expectations and incentivize the user to return to the site in the future frequently. The goal for this project is to elevate the current developing application to a system that encourages users to return to the site, become curious about the time period, seek to contribute and leverage the system to independently 11 conducted research. We believe the most value can be added through improving the user experience by fixing deployment issues and running user experience testing because these are the most critical factors in user retention.

In today’s fast-paced world most Americans carry a smartphone everywhere they go. Smartphones provide a platform for mobile apps that are easy to use and contain rich information. Additionally, smartphones are rarely left at home and they do not wear out like paper. The goal of the Phipps Conservatory Member Card App was to design, develop, and deploy a smart replacement for Phipps’ paper member cards. The app would not only provide an electronic member card, but give members the ability to change their information, see recent news, and download smartphone wallpapers.

The team built a mobile friendly web application that construction industry workers can use as a means for quality control. This application forces engineers and quality assurance specialists to complete structural tests on individual building components. The application makes this information available to all users associated to a project and helps the project owner from being blindsided about potential building collapse risks. The application the team built is comprised of a strong visual front end so that engineers would have no difficulties using the system. The system is designed in such a way to prevent cheating when importing project information and completing tests. With this application, construction professionals are able to see which engineers and architects have a history of safely constructed buildings.

Our project aims to overhaul the current process of taking attendance at the YMCA. Rather than using three different attendance sheets, the system would be capable of keeping track of attendance on a single sheet for each program. The system is integrated into the existing databases that the YMCA uses for attendance and other metrics -- Daxko, PELICAN, Apricot -- and generates reports for administrative use.

Our goal is to revamp the site such that the Path to a Cure site is more animated, intuitive, and interactive by educating first time users what Mitochondrial Disease is and entails, add milestones of achievements that the UMDF has made, and offering more customization to the bricks. This way, we can attract, educate, and retain new donors to the site. Combining the Path to a Cure site with their home site will save them money.

Our vision consists of three parts. First, we want to ensure efficient, effective data collection by developing business processes around an offline survey tool so that it is accessible in the parking lots. Second, we want to provide appropriate data visualizations so that PRC can better understand their customers, strengthen their value to the community, and procure more funds from the Page 31 municipalities. Third, we want to develop an events filtering map that will be featured on the PRC website. The map will display upcoming PRC events and allow users to filter by different event types near them. We hope that the events platform will increase PRC’s membership value proposition and encourage users to visit their site.

Our vision for this project was threefold: enabling data persistency, enhancing security, and building admin features. To enable data persistence, we created accounts for guardians and volunteers so that they could access and edit their information from year to year. For enhancing security, we established that satisfying brakeman tests and removing data once it has been signed off on, are appropriate security measures for this project. In terms of building admin features we provided additional analytics and a revised team management system.
Our team proposes an application that shows all animals needing fostering, and matches each to the best foster parent, so the staff can quickly and easily foster out animals as quickly as possible.

We propose to first robustly test the application models and fix the 6 high-priority GitHub issues that are bug and security related. We aim to use this as a fundamental version of the application that is stable and free of functional errors. The next step is to build a notification feature in conjunction with the existing features to alert the users under different situations. For SCC members, the notification feature alerts them when a note is posted to a member. For student users, the feature alerts them when a requested tool becomes available, when a watch shift is imminent, and when organization starts downtime.

Our vision is to implement a web application that will increase the reliability and efficiency of the equipment rental process. With the planned web application, CMU Athletics will be able to reliably track who rents out what equipment and when the equipment is rented out. This will allow the organization to ensure that the equipment is returned and customer rental information is tracked. The student employees working at the equipment desk will also be able to improve the efficiency in which equipment is checked out and checked in. This will be done by reducing the human input and automating much of the information tracked in the system.

Our goal was to create a scheduling system that can be integrated through a responsive web application. The system would consolidate all children’s schedules into one system that can be updated by case specialists and admins, and accessed by case aides. Based on the children’s schedules and the planned trips for the case aides, the system would be able to notify employees of canceled trips, when help is needed, and when schedules are submitted for approval to the administrators. We created our solution using a Ruby on Rails application hosted on an IS department server, cmuisprojects.org, with a server provided by Auberle’s third party IT vendor (Ideal Integrations). The stakeholders for our application are the Foster Care Director, Ideal Integrations, the Director of Facilities and Operations, case specialists and aides, along with foster 31 families and childern. Our users are the Foster Care Directer - Suzi, case specialists, cae aides, and case managers.

This project is done in partnership between the Kodiak Island Borough School District and the NOAA Kodiak Lab. The Kodiak Island Borough School District is a public school district made up of four elementary schools, one middle school, one high school, and one home school education program in Kodiak, Alaska. The Kodiak Lab is part of NOAA’s Shellfish Assessment Program, which seeks to assess the distribution and abundance of commercially important crab resources in the eastern Bering Sea. Shellfish Assessment scientists collect data which are used to aid in the fishing industry in locating productive fishing grounds and help Crab Fisheries Management regulate takes to improve the viability of future crab stocks.

We will be developing a two-part information system to collect data about student experience and learning for Harrison Middle School students and the IKS Highlander mission director. This information system will consist of collecting student metrics about both soft and hard skills and generating reports for funding petitions and simulation/Mission Ops improvements. This is the first solution to be developed for the school, and there are currently no alternative technological solutions. Instead, feedback is sparingly collected in the form of written essays completed at the end of each simulation.

412 Food Rescue partners with food retailers, nonprofit organizations, and Food Rescue Volunteers to bring healthy food directly to those experiencing food insecurity. 412 Food Rescue’s technology platform, also known as “Food Rescue Hero,” is an end-to-end system that matches food donations to the appropriate nonprofits, coordinates a last-mile transportation network of volunteers, trains volunteers on food safety and tracks data and analytics–measuring impact on hunger and the environment. The CMU IS students worked with a graduate project in Machine Learning to most fairly dispatch food rescues to nonprofits - they created an easy-to-use front-end and a more streamlined experience for the food dispatchers to take advantage of advanced analytics provided by machine learning tools.

A Footbridge facilitates community donations to caregivers of children experiencing financial stress and provides skill-building in areas such as financial literacy and healthy parent-child relationships. The CMU IS students developed an initial website for this new nonprofit with functionality to allow for donation requests, validation and site use.

The Carnegie Mellon Robotics Institute Summer Scholars (RISS) program cultivates talented robotics students from around the world. In order to offer this world-class experience equitably, the RISS wanted a clear and unbiased application process. The CMU students created a new system for submission, review and acceptance of applicants to the summer program. They streamlined the process and included features to reduce bias in the process.

The Quaker Valley Council of Governments (QV COG) is a non-profit organization that facilitates multi-municipal efforts and implements efficient, cost-effective programs on behalf of its members. The CMU IS students built a web-based application for citizens of the Quaker Valley region to submit feedback about their community. The QVCOG uses the feedback to make program recommendations for their constituents.

Sustainable Pittsburgh is a non-profit aimed at improving and encouraging sustainable practices in Pittsburgh. The CMU IS student team made user experience improvements to the web portal used in their annual Sustainable Pittsburgh Challenge competition, with the aim of increasing the number of participants, decreasing the time it takes for the participants to submit evidence, and decreasing the time it takes for the organizers to process these submissions, which will allow our client to further scale the competition in the future.

Adagio Health provides health and wellness services to all women and their families with a focus on those in need, emphasizing reproductive health services as well as cancer screenings. The CMU IS students redesigned the underlying database for their mammogram voucher program and developed an initial application foundation to replace Adagio's current but outdated system. The new database and app foundation allows for much needed compatibility with the new state medical database, and offers streamlined user management and information access.

We envisioned a simple, easy-to-use system for employee nomination. We want to streamline the approval process for employees instead of having week- or month-long delays. We want to be able to easily appreciate the employees who have been recognized widely by many of their peers. Most importantly, we want to highlight exceptional employees and provide them with a meaningful and sizable suite of perks to incentivize their hard work.

East End Cooperative Ministry is a Pittsburgh organization whose mission is to reduce the effects of poverty in the community. It offers a food pantry, community lunches, rehabilitation, and youth programs. Our application automatically enters donations from its online donation system to its database system. This project provides value by saving the EECM employees time and ensuring that their database records are accurate.

Matt's Maker Space is a nonprofit that supports and funds makerspaces across Pittsburgh. Their mission is to inspire a new generation of creative, collaborative, and experiential learners through STEAM focused programming. The CMU IS students worked on creating an easy-to-use lesson plan sharing platform and database so that teachers could create, save, browse, and search lesson plans all in one place. This will help teachers in creating and finding lesson plans tailored uniquely to their students, which will maximize learning and use of makerspaces.

SVPP's mission is to build powerful relationships between innovative nonprofits and engaged philanthropists to tackle the Pittsburgh community’s biggest challenges. The CMU IS student team built a web application to serve as the hub of SVPP's data on partner philanthropists and local nonprofits, as well as assist with matching partners with nonprofits. This webapp consolidates and allows for the updating of data that was previously only in Google Drive or physical forms, streamlines and automates the previously manual process of matching partners and nonprofits for mentorship and ad-hoc consulting, and makes the administration of SVPP more efficient.

Amachi Pittsburgh's mission is to provide assistance for children of incarcerated parents. The CMU IS students implemented a complete redesign of the website, based on the pain points of various key stakeholder groups. The new design simplifies the user experience of the current website and makes it easier for different stakeholders to fulfill their needs, while exuding a brand that more closely matches how people see Amachi.

Computer Reach promotes technological literacy by providing refurbished equitment, computer literacy training, and support services to those who need it most. The CMU IS students integrated their POS software with their inventory management system. The result helped save staff many hours lost due to manually inputting transaction data into their inventory management system.

The goal of this project was to improve data entry and inventory management, saving time and effort for the GWCFB staff and streamlining the reporting process for funding agencies. To accomplish this, the project aimed to reduce the number of human errors and improve efficiency in the data entry process for food donation and distribution. The solution was to find and document a new inventory management system to be implemented in place of their current accounting software. This includes a mobile application with scanning capability, as well as a website platform. Our stakeholders were the Greater Washington County Food Bank, its employees, the patrons that rely on the food bank, donors to the food bank, and volunteers. Our solution saves the organization time, limits human errors, and helps reduce food waste from untracked, expired donations.

partner: Western Pennsylvania School for the Deaf
desc: The Western Pennsylvania's School for the Deaf's affiliate program Choices for Children is an early intervention program supporting parents of deaf or hard-of-hearing newborns by teaching them how to raise their child. The CMU IS students developed a website for this program, serving as a resource bank for parents to garner accurate information on CFC and deaf or hard-of-hearing children. The website was set up on the new CFC domain, increasing the online presence of CFC and information availability on deaf and hard-of-hearing children.

KidsVoice is a nonprofit legal agency that represents abused, neglected, and at-risk children, up to the age of 24. The CMU IS team created a database and data migration solution that is able automate the process of tracking clients and their relevant cases. This project helps save KidsVoice 5-7 hours per week.

Peoples Oakland, is an organization focusing on the rehabilitation and recovery of its members, many of whom have some sort of a chronic mental illness. The CMU IS students implemented a complete redesign of Peoples Oakland site to address the painpoints of Peoples Oakland's members and web admin. The redesigned website significantly improves the user experience and addresses the needs of more stakeholders (members, providers, and supporters) while making the backend processes for the web admin more efficient.

The Children's Home of Pittsburgh is an independent, non-profit, licensed organization whose mission is to promote the health and wellbeing of infants and children through services that establish and strengthen the family. The CMU IS student team digitized the breast-milk verification and inventory tracking system. This system helps streamline the bottle check in and checkout processes, saves paperwork from the old manual process, and reduces human error by delegating calculations to the technology.

The Primate Portal at the Seneca Park Zoo in Upstate NY is a research and STEM outreach project that provides interdisciplinary science experiences for children and adults. The public zoo exhibit allows visitors to watch olive baboons solve cognitive problems presented as computerized tasks on a touchscreen. The CMU IS student team integrated and automated the submission of elementary student scratch code, the translation of the code to the touchscreen for the baboons to interact with and the presentation of livestream video of the baboons to youtube. This greatly expands the outreach and allows students to observe baboons interacting with their code, increasing student interest in biology, psychology and computer science.

The Filipino-American Association of Pittsburgh's mission is to preserve, promote, and perpetuate the Filipino heritage among its members and the general public through cultural, charitable, and educational activities. The CMU IS students improved their data management due to their lack of centralization and automation. The result was an improved website with automated data collection and transfer of legacy data into their new system.

Pittsburgh Lutheran United Ministries (PLUM) is a unique and innovative community service provider that brings together ten Lutheran congregations in the greater Pittsburgh area. The CMU IS students implemented a Google ecosystem for storing data securely, managing files effectively, and managing various schedules for pastoral care events.

The mission of The Italian Garden Project is to celebrate the joy and wisdom inherent in the traditional Italian American vegetable garden, preserving this heritage and demonstrating its relevance for reconnecting to our food, our families and the earth. The CMU IS students created The Legacy Fig Tree Archive website that allows individuals to enter their fig tree into the archive and search the database for the fig trees. The archive demonstrates the prevalence of the fig growing tradition throughout the US and creates a sense of community for fig tree owners.

partner: Big Brothers Big Sisters of Greater Pittsburgh
desc: Big Brothers Big Sisters of Greater Pittsburgh creates one-to-one mentoring relationships between youth and volunteer mentors. The CMU IS student team developed a tracker for potential mentors to view their progress in the application process.. The initiative will increase applicant retention by offering transparency into the lengthy and complex journey.

Project Dream is run by a professor for the CMU English Department who focuses on Digital Humanities and Early and Modern Drama.  The student team repaired and improved a web app that was out-of-date. The app is a corpus creation tool to query a database of 40,000 normalized texts by keywords, titles, years, and authors to help early English researchers answer the questions they are most interested in.

CMU Regional Impact is a university-led initiative that leverages the institution's resources and expertise to broaden CMU’s cultural, economic, and societal impact throughout the Pittsburgh region and the Commonwealth of Pennsylvania. The CMU IS students developed an interactive Tableau dashboard to analyze and communicate CMU’s impact, designed an analytics-backed community impact report template, and performed user testing for current data collection methods. As a result, CMU Regional Impact has the framework to increase initiative visibility, improve data collection methods, and ability to analyze and communicate CMU’s impact to relevant stakeholders.

The Filipino American Association of Pittsburgh (FAAP) is a cultural organization that aims to preserve, promote and perpetuate the Filipino heritage among our members and the general public through cultural, charitable and educational activities. The CMU team created a robust and user-friendly online public directory for business entities owned or recommended by FAAP and Filipino community members. This directory will serve as a comprehensive resource to assist new and existing residents in discovering their options while also boosting local, minority-owned businesses in Western Pennsylvania, Ohio, and West Virginia.

First Tee is a youth development organization introducing the game of golf and its inherent values to young people. During bad weather, First Tee Pittsburgh coaches often need to cancel golf classes and must notify the participants as soon as possible, which can be quite an arduous task. To solve this, the CMU IS Student team created a user-friendly application that allows First Tee PIttsburgh coaches to send mass text and email notifications to class participants in case sudden cancellations with just the click of a few buttons.

II4T offers a comprehensive array of STEM education initiatives aimed at engaging and preparing students for 21st-century careers such as robotics and drones, including skills from computer science and engineering designed to inspire and excite students about STEM fields. The CMU IS student team added a resources tab to their existing website to increase access to valuable resources for students and teachers. Additionally, they provided a process for data collection and analysis so II4T could showcasing their impact with more concrete evidence.

The mission of Sojourner House is offering compassionate, faith-based recovery services to women and their children. The CMU IS student team proposed a new two-sided feature with a new portal on the existing webpage for provider-related information display and a system for staff to record important data that can be directly displayed in the portal immediately. This adds value to both Sojourner House and other providers by removing unnecessary wait times in the intake processes and helping Sojourner House to help people at their maximum capacity.

Achieva is a nonprofit organization dedicated to supporting and empowering people with disabilities and their families across Western Pennsylvania. The CMU IS student team developed a fully functional web application to digitize Achieva’s paper-based employee recognition program, enabling staff to issue, track, and redeem Achieva Bucks through a secure and intuitive platform. This system significantly streamlines administrative workload, improves access to rewards for all employees, and enhances transparency and efficiency across the organization’s internal recognition process.

The Battle of Homestead Foundation is dedicated to preserving and promoting the history and ongoing significance of labor struggles, particularly the historic 1892 Homestead Strike. Our student team developed a self-guided digital tour using a no-code WordPress website to educate visitors on key Pittsburgh labor history events and sites.

BrandWorth LLC is a branding firm that specializes in helping small and medium-sized private companies evaluate and place a monetary value on their brand. The student project worked to create a centralized database solution in Airtable that normalizes survey inputs and automates the valuation algorithm processes. This ultimately streamlined the data collection and valuation process in order to reduce manual effort and deliver faster, more accurate brand valuations to their clients.

Christopher’s Kitchen is a nonprofit organization focused on providing food and drink to those who are in the hospital with their loved ones and cannot afford or provide it for themselves. Our group implemented a barcode-scanning mobile app, OrcaScan, together with a custom-built Google Sheet to calculate food donation price of incoming donations. This automation reduced manual data entry, allowing volunteers to spend more time directly supporting families in need.

The Center for Organ Recovery & Education (CORE) is a nonprofit dedicated to saving and healing lives through organ, tissue, and cornea donation. Our team developed a secure, role-based WordPress portal that automates reimbursement requests for surgeons, funeral homes, and per diem staff. The new system has eliminated manual processing steps, saving the finance team over 100 hours per week and dramatically improving transparency and turnaround times for CORE’s partners.

Educating people about interactions with autistic individual. We created a online course using Wix with videos, readings, and quizzes. The project spreads knowledge about how to interact with autistic individuals to a wider groups by making the courses easily accessible and available to a wider public.

Moonshot Mission Control is a cutting-edge research lab and command center in the CMU School of Computer Science’s Gates Center, with a mission to advance space exploration and robotics. They are currently working on the MoonRanger space project, which aims to explore lunar polar ice using an autonomous rover. The consulting team developed a cloud-based archival and backup process while also enhancing the functionality, scalability, and usability of the mission control software’s database used to monitor and command space experiments. These improvements will enable more efficient system operations and ensure the software’s long-term sustainability and maintainability.

Pittsburgh Hires Veterans (PHV) is a nonprofit dedicated to helping U.S. military veterans and their families access education, training, and meaningful employment opportunities. Our team developed a WordPress plugin that matches veteran candidates with job postings based on their skills and preferences, and built tools to manage and automate these matches. This project improved PHV’s ability to efficiently connect veterans with quality jobs, ultimately supporting their transition into the civilian workforce and strengthening local communities.

Queens Gambit is a nonprofit dedicated to empowering underserved youth, particularly girls and students of color, through chess education and leadership development. Our team developed a branded internal rating and leaderboard system to help the organization track student progress without relying on costly United States Chess Federation (USCF) memberships. This solution makes it easier for instructors to run tournaments and record match results, increasing student engagement and supporting long-term program growth.

River Art Works is a nonprofit organization dedicated to promoting community engagement by supporting local artists and investing in youth development through art education. Our team enhanced their digital presence by improving key areas of their website, including the ArtTEK for TEENS program page, the Events page, and proposing a clearer overall site structure through a sitemap, as well as reducing manual workload for staff by developing a streamlined registration process for their programs. As a result, the organization is now better equipped to attract students, engage community members, and manage program registrations more efficiently.

Sweetwater Center for the Arts is a nonprofit organization dedicated to enriching the community through accessible art education and cultural programming. Our team developed an automated survey and analytics dashboard system to help Sweetwater track the outcomes of its new Artist Membership Program. This system will enable staff to collect consistent feedback, measure program impact over time, and strengthen future grant applications and program development.

Wesley Family Services is a nonprofit organization based in Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania, dedicated to providing mental and behavioral health services. Wesley Family Services faces significant inefficiencies in data transformation and retrieval and thus our team developed a powershell scripting solution that automated data retrieval, transformation, and integration. This resulted in a 75% reduction in manual labor hours for data processing,
 cost savings by eliminating reliance on third-party transformation tools, security enhancements, reducing malware risks from third-party data and improved workflow efficiency, allowing IT staff to focus on strategic initiatives.

Yoga in Sewickley is a community-focused studio dedicated to promoting health and wellness and teaching yoga as it should be–mindfully and paying special attention to alignment. The CMU IS team redesigned the studio’s website and created a custom Google Sheets database system to digitize class tracking and revenue management. These solutions modernized the studio’s digital presence, improved operational efficiency, and empowered the studio owner to manage her business more independently.

YWCA Greater Pittsburgh envisions a community that advances education, opportunity, and equity regardless of gender, race, or background. The CMU IS students built a more streamlined workspace—from data entry to visualization—and designed cleaner, purpose-specific interfaces, integrating third-party platform Airtable to better support their operations. This system empowered the organization to increase program operational efficiency, visualize outcomes, and enhance collaboration with community partners and funders to better serve their mission.
